results.title: [Luka Tsaktserlis]
results.brief_description:
An aeroplane comes to life out of the Australian stamp, “Australia circling the earth” and proceeds to fly to London.

An animated short entered to “Create a Stamp Story” section of ACMI’s ‘Screen It’ media making competition for Primary Schools.

group.title: Stamps coming to life: Anderson Creek Primary School

results.title: [Kyrsten Monaghan]
results.brief_description:
Blinky Bill emerges from a stamp and decides to leave his house (which he puts up for sale) and goes surfing. Upon his return, he buys a house from a bear!

An animated short entered to “Create a Stamp Story” section of ACMI’s ‘Screen It’ media making competition for Primary Schools.

group.title: Stamps coming to life: Anderson Creek Primary School

results.title: [Jeremy James]
results.brief_description:
A Regal Angel fish comes to life from a stamp and gets swallowed whole by a whale. Subsequently the whale is speared and the fish escapes from the whale’s stomach. The fish fears being eaten by another whale he encounters later, but miraculously escapes.

An animated short entered to “Create a Stamp Story” section of ACMI’s ‘Screen It’ media making competition for Primary Schools.

results.title: [Calandra Kidd]

People and fish swim off and arounds rocks at the beach. One swimmer eats some food and proceeds to sunbathe.

results.title: [Brent Seymour]
results.brief_description:
The Murray River Queen gets into deep and treacherous waters. People try and save it with chopsticks but alas it eventually sinks. End caption: “they’s why the Poseidon uses a fork”.

An animated short entered to “Create a Stamp Story” section of ACMI’s ‘Screen It’ media making competition for Primary Schools.

results.title: [Adam Tsaktserlis]
results.brief_description:
A passenger on the Murray River Queen gets into trouble when he falls off the ship and seemingly gets eaten by a large fish. Subsequently, the steamer loses oil which drips into the sea.

An animated short entered to “Create a Stamp Story” section of ACMI’s ‘Screen It’ media making competition for Primary Schools.

results.title: Victoria's favourite things
results.brief_description:
Check out what people brought to ACMI for July 2004’s Open House weekend program ‘Victoria’s Favourite Things’.
Recorded live in ACMI’s Screen Pit, the event was modelled on a 1960’s variety show and includes songs, stories, bad jokes and some really interesting stuff.

results.title: Victoria's Favourite Things. Segment 11
results.brief_description: The results of July 2004’s Open House weekend program ‘Victoria’s Favourite Things’. This segment features Kenton from Nundawading who just loves life and the state of Victoria; a woman who has four deeply meaningful Rings; Nairee and Michelle from Traralgon tell us about ‘my dog Oscar’; and Adrian from Brunswick has a passion for Melbourne’s live music scene.
